message.content:
cs.CR, cs.OS, cs.AR, cs.SE, cs.PL 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely category as the paper focuses on control flow integrity and protection against code reuse attacks. 
- cs.OS (Operating Systems) is also likely as the paper specifically targets the Linux kernel. 
- cs.AR (Architecture) is relevant as the paper discusses the ARM Pointer Authentication feature and its integration into the ARMV8-A architecture. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering) is relevant as the paper discusses the implementation of a prototype system using LLVM. 
- cs.PL (Programming Languages) is relevant as the paper discusses the modification of machine instructions to add authentication code and verify function pointers.
